div.h1: Drexel R-IV School Closure Extended Through April 24th, 2020

span.span:
Consistent with today’s stay-at-home order issued by the Cass County Health Department, we are extending our school closure through April 24th, 2020. This also falls in line with Kansas City area school districts’ plans and continues to make the safety & health of our families the top priority. To read the full Cass County order, visit this link - https://www.casscounty.com/DocumentCenter/View/2246/Public-Health-Emergency-Order
The district’s plan for providing resources, links, activities, and ideas to help continue learning from home will continue through April 3rd. As we near April 3rd, we will provide more information on how school will look through April 24th.

For those families who have indicated a need for internet access, the district has placed an order for hotspot and data bundles. Once those items are delivered to the school, we will make arrangements to deliver to those families. For students in grades 3rd – 12th grade who are in need of their Chromebook, be sure to email tech@drexelbobcats.net.
Meal pick-ups will continue as this is considered an essential service. If you would like to have a meal each day for your school-aged child please email meals@drexelbobcats.net and we can get you on the list.
Thank you for your patience and understanding!
